content.description: 5.12 intro climbing to crux near the top. Finishes on anchors on Movie Star
Climb Movie Star and move left at rail. Finish on Unshackled. Classic.

climbs.name: Unshackled
climbs.fa: Equipped by Doug Reed; FA: Greg Kottcamp

content.description:
This is as good as Southern sandstone sport climbing gets.  A steep, eye-catching line with perfect rock, and engaging moves that don't let up until you clip the chains.  A great test of power-endurance.

 Scramble up the pillar then follow good holds to a short crimp section before a good rest below the first crux.  Cast into a fingery V6 boulder problem involving sequential slopey edges and a long move to a decent one-pad edge.  Grab another marginal rest in the horizontal break below the next roof.  Don't celebrate yet.  Another V6ish boulder problem with long moves between small edges take you over the roof to the anchors.

 Savor this one.  It's one of the best in LRC if not the entire South.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just right of Area of Doubt.

content.description: Do Unshackled, but before going out right towards chain draw and knee bar rest, go straight up using undercling and slopers. Adds a little boulder and removes knee bar rest. Also makes the route more linear and logical. Bit harder than Unshackled.
Short. Easy few overhung moves to distinctive crux on smaller holds pulling out.
content.location: Second route on the roofy bit after Iron Mike. It's the route with the lowest anchor. Middle of the main part of this wall.

content.description: Climb up some crap to the big ledge and first bolt. Make move on small holds and continue up blocky jugs on varying overhang to thinner finish at anchor.  I personally enjoyed this more than Dogtown.
content.location: After the approach turn left, third bolt line.

content.description: Climb up easy terrain to ledge, clip bolt, head up and right on steep wall with good holds. Find rests and fight pump to the anchor. Good route.
content.location: Left after the approach. The last of four routes that climbs through the ledge under the row of bolts. One left of Iron Mike.

content.description: Tough boulder up roof terrain. Easy run-out climbing to anchor. Good boulder but too short for a good rating.
content.location: First route after the overhung alcove and on the steepest short roof section.

content.description: Classic route! Climb up on jugs, edges, and underclings to a series of rails at the second bolt. Pull up to a block, clip the third bolt, and start the real business. A big move leads to a jug to clip the fourth bolt. Crank onto the headwall, and tackle the last challenging moves to gain a stance and clip the anchor. Phenomenal climbing.
content.protection: If you have a long enough stick clip you can prehang all of the draws except for the anchor with the help of the large boulder behind the climb. 4 bolts, ring anchors.
content.location: When looking at the Unshackled Face, the route is the third from the right.

climbs.name: Lone Wolf aka Redneck Girls in Love

content.description: Short and fun. Scramble up the mellow face to a big ledge and clip your first bolt. Head up and clip the second bolt right around the short crux, then meander right and left to the anchors. Be kind, leave the lower biners
content.location: Two to the left of Iron Mike and left of the biggest part of the roof cap. It shares the same face scramble to the right side of the ledge as Ron's, where you clip the first bolt left of Ron's. Not likely to reach either Lone or Ron's first bolt with a stick clip

content.description: Fun jugging up steep terrain to a distinct crux right when you're pumped.
content.location: In the middle of the wall just around the corner and to the right from main Unshackled overhang. The bottom of the climb has a vertical crack, and then continues up blocks to the top. Between two other steep routes (Ron's route and Casper).

content.description: Good rock quality. Climb a variety of positive holds to a crimp crux guarding the chains.
This is a good warmup for the harder routes at Unshackled. Moderate climbing to a roof where an awkward mantle gets you over the lip to the chains.
content.location: From the downclimb, head left (climber's right) past the ampitheater with Iron Mike. This starts at the base of a boulder on the far side of the ampitheater.

content.description: Fun route that weaves back and forth across a blunt/blocky arete. It climbs much better than it looks.
content.location: Go left from the climb down, on the main face it's the furthest left, climbing up the arete.

content.description: Start with a reach to a crimp then steep jugs to abrupt v6ish crux past last bolt. Pretty good, should get more traffic. 12d/13a
content.location: Next route past (to the right) of Iron Mike.

content.description: Climb next to arete through various cruxy moves to stance. Stretch the hips and hamstrings to gain flake, jugs to anchors. Ignore cold shuts.
content.location: Farthest right bolted route on Unshackled buttress

content.description: Easy/wet corner to start (or some have done a direct boulder problem start), and then easy climbing to the 3rd bolt. From here, the next 2 bolts are relentless thin, yet powerful crimping clocking in at perhaps hard v9? The 5th bolt is best skipped on point. A quick shake at the 6th bolt and then a few moves of 11+ take you to the anchors. Incredible route that deserves more hype. Zero pump climbing, just a very hard boulder problem.
content.location: Leftmost route on the unshackled wall. Left of area of doubt. 2 left of unshackled.

content.description: Climb Area of Doubt and clip the anchors with a sling. Shake at the jug and then traverse right to finish on Unshackled. Doesn't add much difficulty, if any, but it adds some excellent climbing and allows you to top the cliff.

True, this route is manufactured, but it is damn fun.  Mostly natural holds with a few enhanced or straight-up drilled pockets to fill in the gaps.  May have gone natural, but we will never know.

 From the top of the pillar, establish on the wall and make some big moves on sidepulls and pockets to the first rest on a large horn.  Make a long move to a good hold, then move slightly right and start an extended crux section with a mix of nice edges, underclings, and drilled pockets.  A few moves are a bit reachy, but not stopper for shorter folks.  At the end of the crux is a slight rest, and then a very thin crimp redpoint crux right at the end.  Save a little energy to clip the chains because there isn't a great clipping hold.

 Wish this thing went to the top of the wall like Unshackled...
content.location: Left most route before the large corner.

content.description: The home of the classic 'Unshackled' (13b), 'Movie Star' (5.12b) and several other great routes varying in grade and quality. The wall gets sun until afternoon, shade times depend on the part of the wall and season of the year.
